Alaska.mail_request_instructions: Request or fill out an absentee ballot application and send it to your local Absentee Office.
Alaska.in_person_request_instructions: Visit an early/in-person absentee voting location starting 15 days before the election.
Alaska.ballot_delivery: Postmarked or delivered by election day.

Alabama.mail_instructions:
Request or fill out a ballot application and send it/take it to your local election manager. You'll need to provide:

  • your name
  • home address
  • mailing address
  • photo ID
  • your signature
Alabama.in_person_request_instructions: Delivered to your local election manager by 5 p.m. the day before te election.
Alabama.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're

  • out of the country
  • ill
  • working a 10-hour shift
  • caring for a family member who's confined to their home
  • incarcerated (though not if you've been convicted of a felony)

Arkansas.mail_instructions: Request or download an absentee ballot application from your County Clerk.
Arkansas.in_person_request_instructions: Deliver your absentee ballot application by the day before the election.
Arkansas.ballot_delivery: In person: Before election day. By mail: Received by 7:30 p.m. on election day.
Arkansas.requirements:
To vote absentee, you must:

  • be unable to get to your polling site
  • ill
  • have a physical disability
  • indicate if you'll be picking you your ballot in person, by mail, or bearer (i.e. someone else is getting it for you)

Arizona.mail_instructions: Sign up online or contact your County Recorder to get added to AZ's "permanent early voting list".
Arizona.in_person_request_instructions: You can vote early in person starting 27 days before the election at an early voting location. Learn more about how and where.
Arizona.ballot_delivery: Election day. You can return ballots to your , any voting location, or any designated ballot return box.
Arizona.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered)..

California.mail_instructions: Fill out a vote-by-mail application (or use the one that comes in your voter guide) and return it to your local elections office.
California.mail_request_deadline: 7 days before the election. If you miss this deadline, you can still apply in person. Some counties even let you apply by phone!
California.in_person_request_instructions: Some counties offer in-person early voting. Find out if you can vote early.
California.ballot_delivery: Postmarked or returned in person by election day.
California.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered)..

Colorado.types: CO has a vote-by-mail system, in which ballots are automatically mailed to registered voters. You can also vote in person.
Colorado.mail_instructions: Every voter receives a mail ballot sent to the mailing address you listed when you registered.
Colorado.mail_request_deadline: You don't need to request a by-mail ballot in CO. They'll send it as long as youre registered.
Colorado.in_person_request_instructions: You can drop off your ballot in person before the election. Get in touch with your county clerk to learn where and when.
Colorado.ballot_delivery: Your county clerk must receive your ballot by 7 p.m. on election day.
Colorado.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered)..

Connecticut.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and send it to your town clerk.
Connecticut.mail_request_deadline: The CT Secretary of State isn't specific, but the state needs to process your application, send you a ballot, and receive your filled out ballot. Give yourself at least 10 days.
Connecticut.in_person_request_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and deliver it to your town clerk.
Connecticut.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're:

  • Out of town on election day
  • ill
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting
  • physically incapable of getting to the polling place

Delaware.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and return it to your local Department of Elections.
Delaware.mail_request_deadline: Deleware stops issuing absentee ballots the day before the election. We recommend getting your ballot request in at least 10 days early.
Delaware.in_person_request_instructions: Same as by mail: Fill out an absentee ballot application and bring it to your local Department of Elections.
Delaware.ballot_delivery: The last day to deliver an absentee ballot by hand is 12 days before the election. Your mailed ballot has to be in by the time the polls close on election day.
Delaware.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're:

  • working
  • away at school
  • ill
  • on vacation
  • physically unable to get to the polls
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting

Florida.types: Florida has vote-by-mail and early voting.
Florida.mail_instructions: Download or request a vote-by-mail application from your county Supervisor of Elections and then send it back.
Florida.in_person_request_instructions: As long as you're registered, you can vote early in person at an early voting site.
Florida.ballot_delivery:
• By-mail ballots must be returned by 7 p.m. on election day
  • In person early voting happens between the 10th and 3rd days before an election. The period may be longer in your area; check with your county Supervisor of Elections
Florida.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered)..

Georgia.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and mail/email/take it back to your local County Board of Registrar's Office.
Georgia.mail_request_deadline: The GA Secretary of State doesn't specify, but leave enough time to submit your application, receive your ballot, and send it back. We recommend at least 10 days before the election.
Georgia.in_person_request_instructions: During the early voting period, you can vote at one of these early vote locations. The early voting period starts 4 Mondays before the election and ends the Friday before election day. You'll fill out an absentee ballot at the early vote location.
Georgia.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered).

Hawaii.types: Hawaii has a vote-by-mail system, in which ballots are automatically mailed to registered voters.
Hawaii.mail_instructions: Your local election clerk will mail you a ballot and an envelope in which to return it.
Hawaii.in_person_request_instructions: You can register and vote early at a voter service center starting 10 days before the election.
Hawaii.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered).

Iowa.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and mail/email/fax/take it to your county auditor.
Iowa.mail_request_deadline:
If requesting by mail:

  • For the general election: 10 days before
  • For other elections: 11 days before

If requesting by email or fax, submit your application the Monday before an election.
Iowa.in_person_request_instructions: Starting 29 days before an election, you can vote at your county auditor's office until the day before an election.
Iowa.ballot_delivery: By the time the polls close on election day.

Idaho.mail_instructions: Fill out this absentee ballot application and send it to your county clerk
Idaho.in_person_request_instructions: You can cast an early vote at an "absent elector's polling place" (ask your county clerk where this is) until 5 p.m. on the Friday before an election. The beginning of this early voting period seems to vary by county; check with your local clerk for specifics.
Idaho.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered).

Illinois.mail_instructions: Apply for a by-mail ballot online, and you'll get a ballot in the mail. Return it to your county clerk.
Illinois.in_person_request_instructions: You can vote in person at an early voting location starting 15 days before an election.
Illinois.ballot_delivery: Return your ballot by election day.
Illinois.requirements: None (exept that you're registered). (exept that you're registered).

Indiana.mail_instructions: The bottom of this page includes forms for mail and in-person absentee voting. Then, mail it to your county election board.
Indiana.in_person_request_instructions: Same as by mail: Fill out the in-person applicaton and take it to your county election board
Indiana.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're:

  • away ot working while the polls are open (6 a.m until 6 pm)
  • physically unable to get to the polls
  • at least 65 years old
  • working at polls outside your voting precinct
  • ill or injured, or caring for someone who's ill or injured
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting
  • part of the state's address confidentiality program.
  • a member of the military or a public safety officer.
  • a "serious sex offender" per Indiana's law (35-42-4-14(a)).
  • have no transportation to the polls

Kansas.types: Advance voting by mail and in person
Kansas.mail_instructions: Fill out an advance vote application or request one and return itx` to your county elections office.
Kansas.in_person_request_instructions: You can vote in person before the election at your county elections office. Advance voting start dates vary by county.
Kansas.ballot_delivery: Received no later than 3 days after the election.

Kentucky.mail_instructions: Request an absentee application from your country clerk.
Kentucky.in_person_request_instructions: Same as by mail: Visit your country clerk--request an application from your county clerk.
Kentucky.ballot_delivery: Mail your ballot back by 6 p.m. on election day. Check with your county clerk to see when you can return your in-person absentee ballot.
Kentucky.requirements:
Kentucky has You can vote absentee if you're

  • ill
  • elderly
  • A a student who's out of the country
  • outside of the state but eligible to vote
  • incarcerated but not convicted
  • working

Louisiana.types: By mail and early in person.
Louisiana.mail_instructions: Submit an application to your registrar of voters. You can also apply through LA's online system.
Louisiana.in_person_request_instructions: Go to your local Registrars of Voters Office to vote early.
Louisiana.ballot_delivery:
• In person: You can vote between 14 and 7 days before the election
  • Early voting By mail: 4:30 p.m. the day before the election
.
Louisiana.requirements:
You can vote early for any reason. You can vote by mail if you're:

  • 65 years old or older
  • live or work away from home
  • incarcerated by not convicted
  • physically incapable of getting to the polls
.

Massachusetts.types: The Secretary of state mostly gives instructions for absentee by-mail voting, but in-person is possible, too.
Massachusetts.mail_instructions: Download (or request) and fill out an absentee ballot application from your county clerk.
Massachusetts.mail_request_deadline: By 12 p.m. on the day before the election. If the day before is a holiday or a Sunday, in which case by 5 p.m. the last business day before the election.
Massachusetts.in_person_request_instructions: If you want to vote absentee in person, get in touch with county clerk.'>your local election official
Massachusetts.ballot_delivery: By the time the polls close on election day.
Massachusetts.requirements: You can vote absentee if you're going to be out of the state on election day, physically incapable of getting to the polls, or religious beliefs prevent you.

Maryland.mail_instructions: Request an absentee ballot online, or download the application and return it to your local board of elections.
Maryland.mail_request_deadline:
• A week before the election if you want your ballot by mail or fax
  • 4 days before the election if you'll be downloading it through MD's online system
Maryland.in_person_request_instructions: You can vote early at an early voting center. Check this MD Board of Elections page for when you can vote early in 2020.
Maryland.ballot_delivery: If you're turning in your ballot in person,
Maryland.requirements: Your mailed ballot has to be postmarked by the election and received no later than 10 days after the election.

Michigan.mail_instructions: Download an application (or request one) and return it to your town clerk.
Michigan.mail_request_deadline: By 5 p.m. the Friday before an election.
Michigan.in_person_request_instructions: The in-person request deadline is later than the by-mail deadline: You can get an absentee application until 4 p.m. the day before an election.

Minnesota.types: Early voting by mail or or in person.
Minnesota.mail_instructions: Fill out an absentee ballot application and return it to your county elections office.
Minnesota.mail_request_deadline: The deadline is the day before the election, but if you're mailing your ballot, make sure you leave time to receive it and return it by the deadline.
Minnesota.in_person_request_instructions: Go to your county election office to register and vote early. There may be other early voting locations, too; check with your local office to find out more.
Minnesota.ballot_delivery: If voting by mail: By election day. The in-person early voting period are open more than a month before the election.
Minnesota.requirements: None to apply, but you'll need a witness when you're filling out the ballot.

Mississippi.types: Mississippi makes it pretty difficult to learn how to vote absentee, but it is possible. You can vote by mail or in person if you meet the requirements.
Mississippi.mail_instructions: Contact your county/municipal clerk. They will probably have you fill out an absentee ballot form like this one.
Mississippi.mail_request_deadline: We couldn't find an official absentee ballot request deadline, but leave enough time to get your ballot, fill it out, and return it by the absentee voting deadline.
Mississippi.in_person_request_instructions: Same as by mail: Go to your county/municipal clerk's office and apply to vote absentee.
Mississippi.ballot_delivery: In person: 3 days before the election. By mail: Received the day before the election.
Mississippi.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're

  • elderly
  • ill
  • working
  • out of the state for school
Mississippi.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Missouri.mail_instructions: Request an absentee ballot from your local election authority. You can ask them to mail you a request form, or download this request form and return it via email, mail, or fax.
Missouri.mail_request_deadline: By 5 p.m. 2 Wednesdays before the election.
Missouri.in_person_request_instructions: Go to your local election authority to vote an absentee ballot beginning 6 weeks before an election.
Missouri.requirements:
You can vote absentee if you're

  • ill
  • physically incapable of getting the the polls
  • working
  • out of the state
  • celebrating a religious occasion that prevents you from voting
  • incarcerated but not prevented from voting (e.g. you were convicted of a felony)
  • part of an address confidentiality program
Missouri.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

North Carolina.in_person_request_instructions: You can register and vote the same day at an early voting location.

North Dakota.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Nebraska.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

New Jersey.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

New Mexico.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Nevada.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

New York.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Texas.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Utah.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Virginia.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Vermont.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Washington.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Washington, D.C..span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Wisconsin.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

West Virginia.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.

Wyoming.span_app: Solicitud de boleta en ausencia española.
